original_review.review_text: I still wear this jacket often when it’s not too cold. It keeps me warm for the most part with just a long sleeve shirt. I like that it’s very compact and lightweight the down jacket. I happen to love the yellow colour on this jacket, it’s very robust. But it’s not for everybody. This is a good jacket for fall, autumn, maybe early winter, but this won’t keep you warm when it’s very cold like in the minus. The jacket is very light and is not meant for extreme cold temperatures. The zipper seems okay a little flimsy at times. I bought the jacket on sale so the value for the money was decent. It seems to do well when it gets wet a bit, but I don’t know how well it would do with sever raining or with thunderstorms. It seems to be a little waterproof to a certain point. Read more

original_review.review_text: Listen up, tech enthusiasts! I've just experienced a revelation, and it comes in the form of this Amazon Fire TV Stick HD! This isn't just a streaming device; it's a full-blown entertainment revolution! Plug it in, and BAM! Your TV transforms into a gateway to endless entertainment. The picture quality? Crisp and clear, like looking through a freshly cleaned window. And the streaming? Smooth as butter on a hot summer day! The Alexa Voice Remote is where the real magic happens. Just speak your commands, and the Fire Stick obeys! It's like having a digital assistant who knows exactly what you want to watch, before you even know yourself! And the content? A treasure trove! Movies, TV shows, live channels – it's all there, at your fingertips. I've been lost in a sea of entertainment, discovering new favorites and revisiting old classics. This Fire TV Stick is fast, it's powerful, and it's incredibly easy to use. It's the perfect solution for anyone who wants to upgrade their TV experience without breaking the bank. Forget clunky boxes and tangled cables! The Amazon Fire TV Stick HD is the future of streaming, and it's here to stay! Five stars? Absolutely! This thing is a game-changer! Read more

original_review.review_text: First and foremost, security is paramount when traveling, and this backpack delivers with its anti-theft design. The hidden zipper closures and durable, slash-proof material offer peace of mind, allowing me to navigate crowded airports and bustling city streets worry-free. Beyond its security features, the functionality of this backpack is outstanding. The built-in USB charging port is a game-changer, keeping my devices powered up on the go. Whether it's charging my phone while waiting at the gate or topping up my tablet during a long flight, having easy access to power has been incredibly convenient. Additionally, the backpack's organization is top-notch. The well-designed compartments and pockets make it a breeze to keep everything in its place, from my laptop and tablet to my passport and travel documents. Plus, the padded laptop sleeve provides extra protection for my tech essentials, giving me peace of mind during transit. And let's talk about comfort. The padded shoulder straps and back panel ensure that even when fully loaded, this backpack remains comfortable to wear for extended periods. Whether I'm dashing through the airport or exploring a new city on foot, I never feel weighed down or uncomfortable. Overall, this carry-on travel backpack is a must-have for any traveler. Its combination of style, security, and convenience make it the ultimate travel companion. I can't recommend it highly enough! Read more

original_review.review_text: This jacket is surprisingly warm considering how thin it is, perfect for milder climates. I took it for a light hike in 8C weather and when it got too hot, I just stowed it away in the included pouch which doesn't take up much space at all - very handy!  However, I don't know how long this jacket will last as the down has been shedding every since I got it. It leaves loose down on whatever you're wearing underneath. After a few hours, it looks like a spend some time playing with a cat. I only paid $38 for it though... at regular price I would not recommend it. Read more

original_review.review_text: The DJI Mini 2 SE Fly More Combo has become an essential part of my photography kit. This lightweight and foldable mini camera drone is perfect for capturing stunning aerial shots during my photo adventures. The compact design makes it incredibly portable, fitting easily into my bag without adding much weight. Despite its small size, the camera quality is outstanding, delivering crisp and clear images that enhance my wildlife and landscape photography. The Fly More Combo is especially convenient, providing extra batteries and accessories that ensure I’m always ready for extended shooting sessions. The intuitive controls and reliable performance give me confidence to capture dynamic shots from unique perspectives. I love how this drone expands my creative possibilities, allowing me to capture breathtaking aerial views with ease. For any photographer looking to elevate their work, the DJI Mini 2 SE Fly More Combo is a fantastic investment. Highly recommended! Read more

original_review.review_text: The Amazon Fire TV Stick HD is, overall, a solid streaming device with some great features, but it doesn’t come without its frustrations. The positives: The user interface is highly intuitive and very responsive -- exactly what you’d expect from an Amazon product. Navigating through menus is smooth, and the layout is simple and easy to follow, which makes using the device a breeze. Setting it up was incredibly easy as well. I was up and running in just a few minutes, with minimal hassle. Alexa integration is another plus, allowing for voice controls that make the overall experience more efficient. However, there are some minor gripes.  One of the biggest selling points is access to "free" video content, which initially sounds fantastic -- who doesn't want more free stuff?  However, the reality is a bit underwhelming. Most of the content under the free tab either isn't that appealing, or you still have to pay to unlock episodes. Youtube is included as part of the "free" but tbh, YouTube is available on almost every TV stick out there. It doesn’t really add anything special to the device. Another slight inconvenience is the frequent need to install third-party apps to access content. You think you've found something to watch, but instead, you're prompted to download and install yet another app before you can actually start streaming. It really breaks one out of s the experience of seamless browsing and watching, which is what you'd expect from a device like this. It would be much better if the content was directly available without all these additional steps. The "free" tab is more geared toward pushing paid content on me than giving me actual free stuff. Every time I browse it, I’m met with more upsells than real free viewing options. At the end of the day, this is still a decent streaming device, especially for those who already have Prime or are deeply integrated into Amazon's ecosystem. But if you're getting it with the expectation of a treasure trove of free content, you’re going to be disappointed. I would like Amazon to improve the quality and availability of truly free content. If they can address that, the Fire TV Stick would be an even stronger contender in the streaming world. Read more

original_review.review_text: Already own a sub 250 gram drone with a 4K camera and 3-axis gimble so... Did extensive research prior to purchasing the DJI Neo by reading/watching lots of reviews. After a few days toying with it, I am 110% sold. Nope by no means is it perfect yet IMHO, the positive far outweigh the negatives. Build quality is first rate in my opinion so should stand up fairly well. Props are well protected, battery latches firmly into place, has a camera guard/cover, power and mode control buttons are top mounted, has voice prompts, available in a "Fly More Combo" kit, etc. Super small footprint yet packs a punch. Multifunction in that it can be flown w/o a phone or RC controller, with a mobile phone, and/or with the DJI RC-N3 remote controller. Has palm takeoff and landing, voice control, AI subject tracking and quickshots, etc. Compared to other drones equipped with a single axis gimble, DJI stabilization technology really does a great job in keeping the footage smooth. I've gotten between 11-13 minutes of battery runtime so we are OK with that. My only real complaint(s) would have to be the limited onboard (non-removable/upgradable) storage. Although 22GB seems fairly ample so far it is an odd choice for such a device... To download footage requires plugging the drone into a device, no battery/power-on needed. Read more

original_review.review_text: Here's my take on this monitor after a few weeks of use. Pros: Cost-Effective: As price was a major factor for me, this monitor met my needs perfectly. It's affordable without sacrificing the quality Samsung is known for. Reliable Brand: Opting for Samsung was an easy choice due to their reputation for reliability. This monitor has lived up to that expectation, operating smoothly since setup. Ideal Port Orientation: Unlike many other brands, the connection ports on this Samsung monitor are oriented downwards. This design choice minimizes stress on the connectors, potentially enhancing their longevity—a subtle yet appreciated feature. Cons: Insufficient Contrast: The monitor falls short in the contrast department. For instance, when I’m on the Gmail page, it's difficult to distinguish between read and unread emails due to the lack of contrast. This can be a significant drawback for those who rely on visual cues for efficiency. Read more

original_review.review_text: Didn’t know totally what to expect for this inexpensive drone but am totally impressed. My use for it is to send it inside buildings prior to responders entering to get an idea of what’s going on inside. It does this perfectly and is low cost enough that if it gets destroyed it’ll be no big deal. Aside from that, using it outside as just a drone with a controller, phone based or with goggles and a handheld controller it works well. I own many other DJI products and have always enjoyed their quality and service. The Neo doesn’t disappoint. Read more

original_review.review_text: The media could not be loaded.\n                 It comes with 3 batteries. 2 propeller replacements. The guards. the drone. A battery charger and instructions. It can follow you. Do a bunch of quickshots. It has pretty good tracking. The video is a bit misleading showing it fly over water though. Flying over water is not advised . Or in low light. or over puddles. The drone seems to do best on a sunny day. You can use the drone on its own. You can use it with a phone or you can use it with the remote. Quality needs some fine tuning and is not the best. Video is alright but could be better. Pictures are not very good quality at all. The drone is super fun to fly though. Even has the ability to use the goggles and fpv remotes. Range is great with the remote. I like it but it really needs a update for flying in low light. Would love to try the fpv. Maybe soon. I can recommend it for beginners and kids. Even for pro's who need a solid little drone for travel. It is a fun one even though it is not the best video and image quality. Read more

original_review.review_text: I ordered it for him for Christmas because he loves yellow jackets for some reason. I ordered a size up so that he can wear a sweater underneath if he wants, and the fit is just right with or without the extra sweater. There are plenty of pockets and the outer ones zip up. The coat is soft, comfortable, and warm enough for around here where it doesn't often go below zero. I don't think it would be warm enough for real winters though. Read more

original_review.review_text: The media could not be loaded.\n                 I was ripped off by DJI as I purchased new and received an open box missing paperwork no bag over drone itself obviously opened box. The battery had 2 cycles /charges again obviously not new. I did not expect this from DJI store as I 8 years in the hobby have never ordered new and received used. No way to contact store to resolve this issue and Amazon support just ending the conversation when I said I received used item when I ordered new. I have a very large following on social media with 3.3 million views being my most viewed of 2024 and I will spread the word that DJI store is a ripp off they ship used drones for new price. I tried to contact and resolve but DJI won’t answer back Read more

original_review.review_text: The jacket is ok. Just ok. It's warm and there is a good amount of down in it. But there are a lot of loose threads everywhere. Feathers pull out constantly. It seems well made in some parts, and sloppy in others. Almost like different parts of the jacket were made by different people. From a name brand like Hilfiger I expected better quality. I bought it on sale. If I would have paid full price, I would have sent it back. Read more

original_review.review_text: I snagged this monitor during black friday sales. It was cheap, $110 but it's a Samsung. The color is good and clear. I do like the matte finish on the screen to reduce reflections. It's perfect for my need as our home computer. The quality isn't as good as my other Samsung curved monitor I use for my office computer but would recommend it for a kid's or 2nd home computer. Decent monitor for the price. Read more

original_review.review_text: This little drone is impressive. It’s so light, but very nimble, and quite fast as well There are so many ways to fly it, wether it’s just from the palm of your hand (don’t forget you will need to activate it first), or with your cellphone (it has a virtual joystick), or with the controller RCN2 or RCN3, or RC2, or with the motion controller, or with the fpv controller 3… even in manual mode with the goggles 3! It can handle winds surprisingly well, and the footage will come out surprisingly good considering. It seems like it was designed to be a selfie drone, but it can do a lot more, even in 4K 30fps or 1080 60fps No D-log or anything like that here, bu If you have a controller, you will be able to make the video a lot better by lowering the sharpness to the minimum. Small hiccup during activation, if you try to do it with an iPad, or a cellphone on wifi, it needs to be connected to the drone’s wifi network, thus disconnecting you from the internet. You need a cellphone with a cellular network and the drone’s network at the same time to get through activation. No obstacle avoidance, but it follows your path very precisely and you can have it avoid trees even in a small forest trail. Read more

original_review.review_text: Samsung LS27T350FHNXZA 27-inch, wow. So vivid it is freaking me out. Produces a true black screen in Photoshop, nice. The viewable lit working portion of the screen is actually 27 inches diagonal, not 26-something. NO GRAY clouds in the corners or on the fringe of the work area. I don't know for certain but this might be the best monitor I have ever owned in 40 years, yet it was the most cost-effective of them all. Read more

original_review.review_text: I purchased this monitor for my wife’s home office and it came with no screws to mount to the stand. When contacting Samsung about the missing parts they first told me that it IS covered under the warranty and that they’ll send the two little screws free of charge. 2 days later however, they sent a random email with a different resolution, that I never agreed to. When I contacted the customer service they said that I had to pay for these 2 little screws, because I didn’t report the missing parts within 48 hours of delivery. However, we never had the opportunity to open the package for a few days because we were out of town. As much as I tried to fight this and escalate this, Samsung refuses to acknowledge their error in this and is putting the blame on us for not noticing the missing parts within their policy time, which is extremely egregious and does not give the customer enough time to notice such things (especially in our case). It is extremely disappointing as this is not the first time Samsung Customer Support has let me down like this. They’ve previously made me give back a free gift because they sent me the wrong colour phone and in order to get the correct colour that I ordered, I had to return the free gift. I can’t believe a company of this size treats their customers so poorly. We are now stuck with a wobbly monitor that could tip over at any given moment, because this billion dollar company won’t waive a $3 fee to send us parts that should’ve been provided to us in the first place. Disgusting. Read more
